perturbation.original_text: the "Services"                  the services to be performed by HealthGate to be                                       set out in the Specification, to include                                       but not limited to (i) any ongoing work in                                       the design and development of the Site;                                       (ii) mounting the Content on HealthGate's                                       Hardware; (iii) hosting and making the                                       Content and portions thereof accessible in                                       an online interactive mode for searching,                                       access, review, displaying in a web                                       browser or on computer terminals,                                       downloading, and printing on paper and;                                       (iv) providing access to Publishers'                                       subscribers and other third parties to the                                       Site through telecommunications access via                                       the Internet.
perturbation.changed_text: the "Services"                  the services to be performed by HealthGate to be                                       set out in the Specification.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the specifics of the services, such as hosting and making content accessible, while other clauses still refer to these detailed services, the contract becomes ambiguous. It creates an internal contradiction because the 'Services' are still referenced, but the definition now lacks essential details, creating uncertainty about HealthGate's actual obligations.

perturbation.changed_text:
12.   Service Levels

      12.1. HealthGate will provide the Services and shall meet basic service standards.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific service levels (prompt query handling, fault identification, software enhancements), but retaining the general commitment to "meet Service Levels", an in-text contradiction is created. The altered clause references a generic commitment, but the specifics defining it are gone, leading to disputes over the actual service standards HealthGate must adhere to. It creates inconsistency with other sections that might depend on the more explicit former clause.

perturbation.original_text: 19.4. Use Fees             The Publishers shall make payments to HealthGate based upon "Use" of             the Content as set forth on the Second Schedule. For the purposes of             this Agreement, "Use" shall mean a retrieval or download by a             Publishers' subscriber of the full-text of an article. There shall             not be any additional use fees or charges for users' browsing of             table of contents or abstracts. Use Fees shall be billed by             HealthGate monthly and all payments are due by cheque by the end of             the following month after the date of the invoice.
perturbation.changed_text: 19.4. Use Fees             The Publishers shall make payments to HealthGate based upon "Use" of             the Content as set forth on the Second Schedule. Use Fees shall be billed by             HealthGate monthly and all payments are due by cheque by the end of             the following month after the date of the invoice.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the definition of "Use" (retrieval or download of full-text article), while still referencing "Use Fees" and the Second Schedule, an internal contradiction arises. The altered clause references the payment based on 'Use', but there's no definition, nor it is restricted to 'downloads', leading to ambiguity. This introduces uncertainty and increases the potential for future disagreements.
